definition: to bring to a conclusion/to settle (a dispute)/to do away with (oneself)/to break off (a relationship)/resolution (of a problem)
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly
to take one's life
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
the end/to conclude
to leave (the stage, an exam room, the playing field etc)/to take part in some activity/to take an examination (in the imperial examination system)
burden
to implicate/to involve
stubborn/willful/pigheaded/Taiwan pr. [zhi2 ao4]
to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to cut off/to chop sth in half
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to abandon/to discard/to renounce/to dump (sb)
to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
bruised/riddled with scars
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to resume/to restart/to start afresh
